result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th) and Operating w/ PAC (4th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Matthew L Graff was found guilty of OWI (4th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: On Case #22CF304-Count # 1 the Court sentences Mr. Graff to serve six months in the Jefferson County Jail with Huber privileges. The Court STAYS this Sentence and places Mr. Graff on Probation for 18 months
--Ignition Interlock Device required on any vehicle driven by the Defendant for a  24 month period

--AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment

--Victim impact panel attendance

--Revocation of drivers license for 24 months

--6 demerit points assessed

--300 days conditional jail time imposed and stayed. This additional conditional jail time can be used at the discretion of the Treatment Court Judge or his designee for sanctions. If the Defendant completes Treatment Court, any remaining conditional jail time will be permanently stayed. However, if the defendant is removed from Treatment Court, this conditional jail time shall be served.

miscConds.notes: --Payment of a fine of $650 plus costs and DNA surcharge= $1,882. The Court grants Mr. Graff sixty days to pay in full or to set up a payment plan with the Clerk of Courts Office. Non-payment will result in 20 days in Jail with Huber privileges consecutive.

--to maintain absolute sobriety: no possession or consumption of alcohol; no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription; to take all prescriptions as prescribed

--no presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores

--no operation of a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license and Agent approval

--to comply with all conditions of Jefferson County Alcohol Treatment Court

--any assessment, treatment or counseling as required by the Agent

timeConds.notes:
--To serve 60 days conditional jail, to be served as follows: 30 days in the Jefferson County Jail, with work release privileges; to commence forthwith, followed immediately by 30 days on Scram Cam (as approved by the Memorandum of Understanding signed by the Jefferson County Sheriff).  Good time credit is to be applied to both components of order.  Release shall be allowed for AA and/or NA meetings. The Court requires Mr. Graff to report and serve this jail term with absolute sobriety and without any non-prescribed controlled substances in his system. Non-compliance will result in loss of work-release privileges without further process.

--The Defendant is allowed one 24-hour, furlough during the initial period of conditional jail for a religious or nationally recognized holiday. Such a day is defined at the foot of the Criminal Case Settlement form. That 24 hour period will not count as time spent serving the sentence, and instead the period of conditional jail will end 24 hours later that it otherwise would have. During the furlough, the Defendant will be required to remain absolutely sober. A Scram monitoring device will be installed and active during that 24 hour period. The Defendant will be required to submit to a urine screen for drugs and alcohol immediately upon returning to the Jail. At least 10 days notice of the potential furlough needs to be given to the jail and WCS so that necessary and appropriate arrangements can be made

--to comply with DNA sample provision

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew L Graff

records.descr: Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan
Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
[MK] cases #22CF304 and #22TR4601 called at 4:40pm
Defendant Matthew L Graff in court with Attorney Craig Kuhary.  ADA Brookellen Teuber in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " Guilty " entered in Case #22CF304-Count #1; factual basis stipulated; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Case #22CF304-Count #2 and Case #22TR4601.


On Case #22CF304-Count # 1 the Court sentences Mr. Graff to serve six months in the Jefferson County Jail with Huber privileges. 
Days credit for time already served: 0 days. 

The Court STAYS this Sentence and places Mr. Graff on Probation for 18 months with conditions:

 --To serve 60 days conditional jail, to be served as follows: 30 days in the Jefferson County Jail, with work release privileges; to commence forthwith, followed immediately by 30 days on Scram Cam (as approved by the Memorandum of Understanding signed by the Jefferson County Sheriff).  Good time credit is to be applied to both components of order.  Release shall be allowed for AA and/or NA meetings. The Court requires Mr. Graff to report and serve this jail term with absolute sobriety and without any non-prescribed controlled substances in his system. Non-compliance will result in loss of work-release privileges without further process.
The Defendant is allowed one 24-hour, furlough during the initial period of conditional jail for a religious or nationally recognized holiday. Such a day is defined at the foot of the Criminal Case Settlement form. That 24 hour period will not count as time spent serving the sentence, and instead the period of conditional jail will end 24 hours later that it otherwise would have. During the furlough, the Defendant will be required to remain absolutely sober. A Scram monitoring device will be installed and active during that 24 hour period. The Defendant will be required to submit to a urine screen for drugs and alcohol immediately upon returning to the Jail. At least 10 days notice of the potential furlough needs to be given to the jail and WCS so that necessary and appropriate arrangements can be made
--to comply with all conditions of Jefferson County Alcohol Treatment Court
--to maintain absolute sobriety: no possession or consumption of alcohol; no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription; to take all prescriptions as prescribed
--no presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores
--no operation of a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license and Agent approval
--any assessment, treatment or counseling as required by the Agent
--300 days conditional jail time imposed and stayed. This additional conditional jail time can be used at the discretion of the Treatment Court Judge or his designee for sanctions. If the Defendant completes Treatment Court, any remaining conditional jail time will be permanently stayed. However, if the defendant is removed from Treatment Court, this conditional jail time shall be served. 
--to comply with DNA sample provision 

The Court orders outright: 
--Payment of a fine of $650 plus costs and DNA surcharge= $1,882. The Court grants Mr. Graff sixty days to pay in full or to set up a payment plan with the Clerk of Courts Office. Non-payment will result in 20 days in Jail with Huber privileges consecutive. 
--Revocation of drivers license for 24 months
--AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment
--Victim impact panel attendance
--Ignition Interlock Device required on any vehicle driven by the Defendant for a  24 month period  
--6 demerit points assessed

Judgment of Conviction to indicate: "ALCOHOL TREATMENT COURT PARTICIPANT" 
Felony firearms/voting prohibition warnings are given. 
recess 5:04pm

Pre-trial conference on October 12, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Status conference on October 24, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

[ml] Cases 22CF304 and 22TR4601 called at 8:42AM
Defendant Matthew L Graff in court with Attorney Craig Michael Kuhary. Da Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
This hearing is scheduled for a Preliminary Hearing, however the Defense files waiver paperwork prior to the case being called. 

As to file 22CF304:
Mr. Graff waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered as to both counts
--in response to the Court's inquiry, both counsel indicate that they are not requesting speedy trial.

The State advises that it has received the results from the blood test, and will forward the results to the Defense along with discovery.

recess 8:47AM

NEXT: As to both files: (1) Pretrial Conference on 10/12 at 11:00AM  (2) Status Conference on 10/24 at 3:00PM

Pre-trial conference on September 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on September 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.

--no possession or consumption of alcohol; no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription;  to take prescription medications only as prescribed
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores
--no operation of a motor vehicle without valid drivers license 
--Defendant is to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Office for booking (fingerprints and photographs)
--The Defendant is to report and comply with SCRAM alcohol monitoring program as administered by Wisconsin Community Services.  The Court orders the defendant to SCRAM monitoring through WCS, with the consideration of Remote Breath as an alternative only when WCS verifies that a defendant's work environment or health condition prohibits the SCRAM bracelet.
The Defendant is to comply with all SCRAM Program conditions of participation including payment of program costs and fees.  The Defendant is to report for SCRAM installation in Room 230 of the Jefferson County Courthouse on 8/8/22 at 1:00 pm. **If in custody, release on SCRAM only.**

[ae] case called 11:00 AM Defendant Matthew L Graff in court. Attorney Craig Michael Kuhary in court. ADA Michaels in court for State of Wisconsin. 
The Defendant verifies that the address and date of birth listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited
 Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint.

The Court requires $750 Signature Bond, with conditions:
--no possession or consumption of alcohol; no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription;  to take prescription medications only as prescribed
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores
--no operation of a motor vehicle without valid drivers license 
--Defendant is to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Office for booking (fingerprints and photographs)
--The Defendant is to report and comply with SCRAM alcohol monitoring program as administered by Wisconsin Community Services.  The Court orders the defendant to SCRAM monitoring through WCS, with the consideration of Remote Breath as an alternative only when WCS verifies that a defendant's work environment or health condition prohibits the SCRAM bracelet.
The Defendant is to comply with all SCRAM Program conditions of participation including payment of program costs and fees.  The Defendant is to report for SCRAM installation in Room 230 of the Jefferson County Courthouse on 8/8/22 at 1:00 pm. **If in custody, release on SCRAM only.** 

recess 11:05 am
